revised_title: Samuel Hawksley Burbury: A Pioneering Figure in Mathematical Physics
tldr: Samuel Hawksley Burbury was a prominent mathematical physicist who specialized in the kinetic theory of gases and the Boltzmann-Maxwell distribution. He contributed to the development of the field by challenging the assumptions and foundations of statistical dynamics, particularly focusing on the differences between 'assumption A' and 'assumption B'. His work has had a lasting impact on the understanding of the behavior of gases and the broader field of mathematical physics.
